channel.title: Paul Krugman
channel.description: Paul Krugman, a New York Times Op-Ed columnist, writes about macroeconomics, trade, health care, social policy and politics. In 2008, he received the Nobel Prize in Economics.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2017 The New York Times Company

item.title: Trump’s Energy, Low and Dirty
item.description: Risking the planet to keep a lie alive.
item.author: By PAUL KRUGMAN

item.title: It’s All About Trump’s Contempt
item.description: His budget and health plan show he despises his voters. Will they notice?
item.author: By PAUL KRUGMAN

item.title: The Unfreeing of American Workers
item.description: Creeping along the real road to serfdom.
item.author: By PAUL KRUGMAN

item.title: What’s the Matter With Republicans?
item.description: We need to understand what made Trump possible.
item.author: By PAUL KRUGMAN

item.title: The Priming of Mr. Donald Trump
item.description: He’s not the only one with fiscal fantasies.
item.author: By PAUL KRUGMAN

item.title: Judas, Tax Cuts and the Great Betrayal
item.description: The Republican response to Trump’s cover-up will live in infamy forever.
item.author: By PAUL KRUGMAN

item.title: Republicans Party Like It’s 1984
item.description: Making policy by lying about everything.
item.author: By PAUL KRUGMAN

item.title: What’s the Matter With Europe?
item.description: Le Pen must be beaten, but then what?
item.author: By PAUL KRUGMAN

item.title: On the Power of Being Awful
item.description: Trump supporters will never admit they were wrong.
item.author: By PAUL KRUGMAN

item.title: Living in the Trump Zone
item.description: We’re in a place and time where childish petulance drives policy.
item.author: By PAUL KRUGMAN
